title: John Haylett, editor of the ‘Morning Star’ who steered the faction-ridden communist paper out of ghetto politics – obituary
text:
John Haylett, who has died aged 74, took over in 1995 as editor of Britain’s last communist newspaper, the Morning Star, amid a dispute of a Byzantine nature worthy of the Kremlin; he played a starring role in what one paper described as “the last great show trial of the Communist era” in 1998 when he was suspended amid accusations of “gross industrial misconduct”.

Founded as the Daily Worker in 1930 with Soviet cash, the paper had been relaunched as the Morning Star in 1966, but never managed to regain the popularity which it had enjoyed at its peak in 1947, when it sold 120,000 copies a day.
